channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7289] Strip Writable from KeyValue
item.description:
Made new issue to strip Writable from KeyValue. It used to be HBASE-7233 but I morphed my own issue discussion of how to serialize KVs.

This issue is about removing Writable from KV and making baseline protobufing work over mapreduce and rpc.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This patch seems to be passing all tests. Will try again in morning.

I tried to make a Serialization that would do for all the hbase objects in MapReduce but messier than just have three Serializers.

This patch also makes Result take pb'd KVs instead of just byte arrays. This is untenable. It'll be too slow. HBase-7233 is about how to fix this. Meantime this can serve as the lowest common denominator.
I think this can go in. See what hadoopqa says. Anyone up for review? Thanks.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12556227/7289.txt
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 15 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3458//console

This message is automatically generated.
Rebase

Looks like Hadoop QA encountered some compilation error (against hadoop 2.0):


[ERROR] COMPILATION ERROR : 

[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------------

[ERROR] /Users/zhihyu/trunk-hbase/hbase-common/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/KeyValue.java:[2673,2] method does not override or implement a method from a supertype

[INFO] 1 error

[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] Reactor Summary:

[INFO] 

[INFO] HBase ............................................. SUCCESS [3.044s]

[INFO] HBase - Common .................................... FAILURE [4.318s]
Retry
All tests pass locally for me. Will commit soon unless objection (Review would be ok too!)

• Talked about removing the io.serialization values from hbase-defaults.xml file since the job setup does that already.
  • Maybe add a test where kv -> byte array output stream -> byte array input stream -> kv.
  • Should WALEdit be changed the same way that key value is here ?
Removed the hbase-default.xml change and I added back a serialization test, one that uses new write and create methods to verify serialization in old way still works.
On the WALEdit, yeah, but different issue I'd say.
+1 Painful but much better than KeyValueBytes. Thanks stack
Committed to trunk. Thanks for the review Elliott

Is it just me who gets the following error ?

Talked about removing the io.serialization values from hbase-defaults.xml file since the job setup does that already.

Thanks Ted. Removing the above seems to have made the tests fail. It set serialization everywhere. I still think it a good idea to leave it out here. Will see what else is broke...
I committed this addendum. I think this test only place the new serialization matters. Will change the test to add the serialization spec rather than put back the hbase-default.xml edit.

Should the changes in addendum be documented in Release Notes ?
Currently user needs to specify "io.serializations" in his / her code.

Should the changes in addendum be documented in Release Notes ?

Let me add it. io.serialization is how 'mapreduce' works so more that realm than hbase but no harm adding the fact that now it has to be specified.... Thanks.

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
Strips Writable from KeyValue. Side effect has us protobuf'ing KeyValue when we put it into a Result so this should SLOW HBase considerably until we address KeyValue serialization over in HBASE-7233.

HBASE-7215 added MapReduce serializers for Result, Put, Delete, etc. This issue adds a serializer for KeyValue. If using HFileOutputFormat, be sure to add the serializer to your configuration: for example:

{code}
    Job job = new Job(conf, "YOUR_MAPREDUCE_JOB");
    job.getConfiguration().setStrings("io.serializations", conf.get("io.serializations"),
        MutationSerialization.class.getName(), ResultSerialization.class.getName(),
        KeyValueSerialization.class.getName());
{code}
